5mm dpns if you are using a short circular row 2 sl1 k5 ssk k1 turn needle there is no need to use dpns if you are using row 3 sl1 p6 p2tog p1 turn magic loop you may prefer to place the spare stitches from the top of the foot onto a stitch holder if you are row 4 sl1 k7 ssk k1 turn using a short circular or dpns whilst you work the heel continue in this way adding one stitch between slip optional slipping the stitches knitwise will twist them stitch and ssk or p2tog on each row ie row 5 sl1 p8 and keep them in line with the twisted stitches worked p2tog p1 row 6 sl1 k9 ssk k1 etc until all of the heel on the leg stitches are used depending on how many stitches are in your heel flap you may find that the k1 and p1 stitch is not required at the end of the last two row 60 sts knit across heel stitches if required to bring you to the row 1 k1 p2 sl1 p2 3 times sl1 p1 sl2 p1 sl1 p2 left hand side of the heel flap with the outside of the 4 times k1 turn 30 sts flap facing you ready to pick up 1 stitch for every 2 row row 2 work all knit and purl stitches as they present of heel flap knitted remember that if you made the heel themselves working purl into the slipped stitches of flap bigger you will need to pick up more stitches once pevious row you have picked up the stitches place marker row 3 sl1 p2 4 times sl1 p1 sl2 p1 sl1 p2 4 times knit across the top of the foot stitches in pattern from k1 turn where you finished for the leg place marker then pick up 1 stitch for every 2 row of heel flap knitted up the other side of the heel knit across the top of the heel and then 64 sts shape gusset as below row 1 k2 p2 sl1 4 times p1 sl2 p1 sl1 p2 4 times note if you are using dpns and/or have placed your sl1 k1 turn 32 sts stitches on a stitch holder you
